text: Jim rutenberg has details from the
latest New York Times CBS News national
political poll Jim we have a new poll
out this morning and there's just really
no good news for Democrats in here is
there yeah not a great day for the
Democrats this is latest in a series of
bad polls showing rough Tuesday night to
come it looks like this coalition that
the Democrats had put together in two
thousand six and two thousand eight is
starting to fall apart a little and
there were two groups that were sort of
seemed to be falling away from the
Democrats that were sort of surprising
Catholic voters and and even more
surprising Women Voters since 1982 when
the exit polls started asking women who
they voted for women have never as a
class voted for the Republican of the
Democrat our poll shows that women now
are choosing the Republican over the
Democratic it's within the margin of
error so this is really slight but it's
a bit troubling sign make sure the
Democrats yeah another big shift is that
voters just seem to be willing to take a
real flyer on an experienced candidate
even one that they perceive as being
kind of extreme absolutely you know more
than a quarter of voters say they will
go with somebody who has extreme views
okay that's exposed answer the question
of extreme views so that shows a level
of desperation mind you a large majority
will not but a much higher percentage
than one would expect is willing to take
a chance so if there's one bright spot
in this whole pole for Democrats not
necessarily the party but for the
president is that people are still
pretty optimistic about the rest of his
term yeah a comfortable majority for the
Democrats of voters say that they're
optimistic about Obama's last two years
but he really has his work cut out for
him they're gonna have to rebuild this
coalition and key to doing that is going
to be wound back women Catholics
independence you name it I mean they
would give a hard road ahead
